name: Karnage Chronicles
detailed_description:
Every five thousand years the planets align and create a rift in the fabric of cosmos. It’s prior to such an event that this story unfolds. Play as a Murkwraith, an undying knight barred from Death’s domain, and cursed to eternal servitude for sins committed eons ago. Experience a rich story that takes you on a perilous journey through dark dungeons filled with monsters, traps, puzzles, treasure and more.

  • Karnage Chronicles is designed from ground up to fully immerse you in the magic of VR.
  • Choose between several types of locomotion by accessing settings in-game. On top of this we fully support Virtuix Omni for a truly immersive experience.
  • Take full advantage of an inventory system made specifically for VR.
  • Unparalleled anti-wiggle system for close quarter combat. In this game you cannot tickle your enemies to death as the velocity of your swing defines the damage you do to your enemies.
  • Customizable weapon presets allow for quick switching between weapons in combat, and there are quickslots for easy access to consumables like potions and food.
  • Parry incoming attacks with your weapon or block them with a shield. Take full advantage of room-scale VR to dodge and sidestep arrows or magic hurled at you from afar.
  • Random loot and hidden treasure awaits. Collect coins, find trash items to sell or random gear to wear.
  • Drop items for safekeeping in your very own room. Visit a shop run by an Imp where you can spend your hard-earned coins to upgrade your gear. Solve quests and gain magical rewards in return.
  • Play as an archer or a warrior, with more classes to come.

Go forth and claim your place among the heroes of legend, Murkwraith.

ALSO AVAILABLE FOR VR ARCADES

Available for Arcades on SpringboardVR

short_description: A true VR RPG built from ground up to fully immerse you in what VR has to offer. Karnage Chronicles reimagines what an epic fantasy can be with unparalleled sense of scale, depth, and immersion.
reviews:
“It's really good! [...] The ambiance of the levels were perfect, the character design was interesting, they had voiced parts that actually made sense, they told a story, and the two different modes that you could play as was totally unique and didn't feel like the same thing at all.”
CryMor Gaming

“I am absolutely blown away by this. The graphics are gorgeous, the combat is really good, the audio, the atmosphere, I mean, this thing got it all. And it's still in Early Access.”
vrgamerdude

“That was hard. No joke. And I didn't even do it on Normal.”
OldSchool Gamer
